value:
Lord Hardin freed the people of the
plains from slavery and gave us
weapons.$k$pNo one had ever so much as
looked our way before that.

So the lost prince mustered up his
strength and rebuilt his homeland...$k$pWho do you think really made that
happen?! The prince certainly wasn't
up to the task, I'll tell you that much.

The bonds between those of us
in the Coyote's Men are strong.$k$pWhether it be in Grust or Macedon,
we can face anyone if the battle is
held on an open field.

When it comes to horseback battles,
none can best Wolf.$k$pHe can tame and ride even the
unruliest of horses and makes deft
use of any weapon he touches.

You shouldn't need the help of others
to maintain your own weapons. That
being said...$k$pI was the best at it, so I'm no stranger
to repairing my team's weapons—
especially Wolf's bow.

I am Sedgar, of the knights of Aurelis.
I was told to give you this by
$Nf.

Moving in perfect unison to deliver a
flurry of strikes... None can withstand
a joint attack from the Coyote's Men!

I care not what justification they
might try to use... I can never forgive
those who invade another's land.

I suppose I shall ride even more
fiercely next time.

You went out of your way to do
this...for me? You have my thanks.

Sedgar, of Aurelis's cavalry. You may
have heard of us—the Coyote's Men.
We are unmatched on the open field.

Wolf, Roshea, and Vyland... We are
the backbone of the Coyote's Men,
and they are like brothers to me.$k$pWe rode across the battlefield and
fought at Lord Hardin's side, crushing
every formation we came across.$k$pEven against the knights of Grust's
Sable Order, or Macedon's Dragoons,
defeat felt as if it were impossible.$k$pWe had overwhelming mobility on the
ground and could shoot down
anything in the sky. We were...strong.$k$pNone could deny our power, but...
In our ambition, we lost sight of
what matters.$k$pAnd not just us, but him as well...
たあっ
いくぞ！
ぐっ
いかん…
Ambition blinds you!
You fool!
Look at yourself!
Charge!
Coyote...
Haha
Sedgar, of the Coyote's Men. Pleased to meet you.
*chuckle* A little rough-housing never hurt anyone.
Believe it or not, I used to think Prince Marth was an entitled brat.

I knew about Lord Hardin's ambition, but for a time
there was nothing I could do.

Wolf has quite a temper. I wish he understood the pressure
it puts on me to rein him in.
Painful as it may have been...there was no other choice.
I can think of no better way to atone for my past than to remain steadfastly by your side.
Yes?
What are you getting at?
Understood.
